channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The 8 Biggest Reasons I’m Excited About BPCON
item.description: This must-attend event features top real estate insights, unmatched networking, and a luxury all-inclusive experience.

item.title: Gogoro delays India plans due to policy uncertainty, launches bike-taxi pilot with Rapido
item.description: Gogoro has deferred its India plans over delay in government incentives, but the Taiwanese company has partnered with Rapido for a bike-taxi pilot. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: FAQ: How The Marshall Project Is Covering the 2024 Election
item.description: Learn more about who we are and how we choose what political stories to cover.

item.title: Investors: Make Sure to Capitalize On “Resolutions of Unacceptable Conditions”
item.description: Inspections are important because you need to know what you're getting into, but they're equally important for the negotiations that can occur after.

item.title: A16z offers social media tips after its founder’s ‘attack’ tweet goes viral
item.description: On Friday, the venture firm Andreessen Horowitz tweeted out a link to its guide on how to “build your social media presence” which features advice for founders. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: A Mother on a Mission for Full Police Transparency
item.description: Troy, Alabama, police severely beat Ulysses Wilkerson when he was 17. Seven years later, his mom, Angela Williams, is still fighting for answers.

item.title: Rookie Reply: Preparing for a Market Crash, Ending Leases, & Building Teams
item.description: As a new investor, a strong real estate team is crucial to your success—especially when you’re looking to land your first deal, complete your first rehab project, or invest out-of-state. […]

item.title: OpenAI shuts down election influence operation that used ChatGPT
item.description: OpenAI has banned a cluster of ChatGPT accounts linked to an Iranian influence operation that was generating content about the U.S. presidential election, according to a blog post on Friday. The company says the operation created AI-generated articles and social media posts, though it doesn’t seem that it reached much of an audience. This is […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: How the 1968 DNC in Chicago Devolved into ‘Unrestrained and Indiscriminate Police Violence’
item.description: As protesters prepare for the Democratic National Convention in Chicago next week, a half-century old report provides lessons for preventing chaos.

item.title: BiggerNews: What Happens if the Housing Market Crashes (& What Will Cause It)
item.description: Recession fears are increasing. The stock market has taken substantial hits, housing inventory is climbing, and bank account balances are starting to fall. So, with more economic turmoil, we have […]

item.title: Apple reportedly has ‘several hundred’ working on a robot arm with attached iPad
item.description: Apple is reportedly shifting into the world of home robots after the wheels came off its electric car. According to a new report from Bloomberg, a team of several hundred is working on its potential first product: a robotic arm with an “iPad-like” display attached. The home product would take a page out of Amazon’s […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Aaron Sankin is The Marshall Project’s new Deputy Data Editor
item.description: Sankin brings deep experience with ambitious data projects.

item.title: Retiring Early Before 30 and Why You DON’T Need Millions for FIRE
item.description: This might be the fastest path to FIRE we’ve ever seen. In just two years, Emily and James were able to retire early and travel the world full-time. They didn’t […]

item.title: Another week in the circle of startup life
item.description: Welcome to Startups Weekly — your weekly recap of everything you can’t miss from the world of startups. I’m Anna Heim from TechCrunch’s international team, and I’ll be writing this newsletter moving forward. Want it in your inbox every Friday? Sign up here. This week, we’re looking at some companies being created, funded, shut down and […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: ‘Deliberate Indifference’: Court Rulings Challenge Extreme Heat Conditions in Prisons
item.description: “If it’s 103 outside, it may be 107 to -8 inside of your cell,” said a man who worked in the fields while imprisoned in Texas.
